name: fresison
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wex(s0, wa(w0, w2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wex(s0, wa(w0, w2))

stmt.origin: mpbi(wex(s0, wa(w0, w2)), wex(s0, wa(w2, w0)))

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w2))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, w0))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w2, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, w0))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w2, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w2)))

body.origin: |- wb(wex(s0, wa(w2, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, w0))

comment: "Fresison", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. No ` ph ` is ` ps ` (PeM), and some ` ps ` is ` ch ` (MiS), therefore some ` ch ` is not ` ph ` (SoP). In Aristotelian notation, EIO-4: PeM and MiS therefore SoP. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.) Shorten and reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)
